Mongrel Mob tangi in Central Hawke’s Bay: Police say there have been no incidents as more than 1000 gang members gather https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/mongrel-mob-tangi-in-central-hawkes-bay-police-say-there-have-been-no-incidents-as-超过 1000 名帮派成员聚集/WKUWJ3SAUBHFDCKHZ6AHSPHNBM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/mongrel-mob-tangi-in-central-hawkes-bay-police-say-there-have-been-no-incidents-as-超过 1000 名帮派成员聚集/WKUWJ3SAUBHFDCKHZ6AHSPHNBM/ An Air Support Unit helicopter, known as Eagle, is arriving in Hawke's Bay this afternoon. Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:45:50 +0000 A Mongrel Mob procession in Central Hawke's Bay as part of the Notorious chapter's national leader Sonny Smith's tangi. Photo / NZME
State Highway 1 north of Temuka closed after serious crashhttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/state-highway-1-north-of-temuka-close-after-serious-crash/X7QE33I7TNGYLG2R2BKYMBWMC4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/state-highway-1-north-of-temuka-close-after-serious-crash/X7QE33I7TNGYLG2R2BKYMBWMC4/ A second road has also been closed after a crash in the North Island. Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:41:11 +0000 Roads are closed after crashes in the North and South Islands.
Hawke’s Bay news in brief: Man and dog rescued off coasthttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hawkes-bay-news-in-brief-man-and-dog-rescued-off-coast/24SKLDH35JG47OHPVEDAMWG3L4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/hawkes-bay-news-in-brief-man-and-dog-rescued-off-coast/24SKLDH35JG47OHPVEDAMWG3L4/ The yacht had damaged sails and was running low on fuel. Gisborne: Katareina Kaiwai honoured for service to women, civil construction https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/03/gisborne-katareina-kaiwai-honoured-for-service-to-women-civil-construction/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/03/gisborne-katareina-kaiwai-honoured-for-service-to-women-civil-construction/ Matai O'Connor, Kaupapa Māori reporterAward recognises Kaiwai's dedication to civil construction. Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:12:03 +0000 Katareina Kaiwai of Tairāwhiti Contractors with her daughter Ruira and her son Motureia. Photo / Rena-Deane Goldsmith
King’s Birthday Honours: Reid Fletcher awarded NZOM for services to the wine industry https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/03/reid-fletcher-awarded-nzom-for-services-to-the-wine-industry/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/03/reid-fletcher-awarded-nzom-for-services-to-the-wine-industry/ Murray RobertsonReid Fletcher is honoured for his service to the Gisborne and New Zealand wine industry. Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:11:55 +0000 Gisborne's Reid Fletcher has been made a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for his nearly 50 years of service to the Gisborne and New Zealand wine industries. Photo / Paul Rickard
Wairoa in Focus: The return of the Frasertown hunt https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/wairoa-in-focus-the-return-of-the-frasertown-hunt/WTBJK6UIQJASVIF5N5KYS2DULU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/wairoa-in-focus-the-return-of-the-frasertown-hunt/WTBJK6UIQJASVIF5N5KYS2DULU/ Ann Revington'It is in your blood, it is part of life. Hopefully, this carries on.' Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:00:00 +0000 One by one the stags and boars were all weighed and then hoisted on to racks by Frasertown Pighunt Wairoa marshals and crew, including club president Mike Foley (third from right). Photo / Ann Revington
National sheep dog title for Wairoa club member Ned Georgehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/national-sheep-dog-title-for-wairoa-club-member-ned-george/LCCMEHGV45FL7BNOWOUV42IIPI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/national-sheep-dog-title-for-wairoa-club-member-ned-george/LCCMEHGV45FL7BNOWOUV42IIPI/ Doug LaingNed George got a push into sheepdog trialling from his grandad and hasn't looked back. Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:00:00 +0000 Wairoa Collie Club member Ned George winning the New Zealand straight hunt title with Bounce last week at Mangamingi, Taranaki. Photo / Suppled.
Struck-off lawyer John Dorbu implies Prime Minister supported his comeback https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/struck-off-lawyer-john-dorbu-implies-prime-minister-supported-his-comeback/U6JNTHCTCRFDFO7F2REZR4KIHE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/struck-off-lawyer-john-dorbu-implies-prime-minister-supported-his-comeback/U6JNTHCTCRFDFO7F2REZR4KIHE/ Jeremy WilkinsonHowever, Christopher Luxon's office said it knew nothing about the case. Mon, 03 Jun 2024 00:00:00 +0000 Prime Minister Christopher Luxon's name was used by James McConnor in support of his application to be granted a lawyer's practising certificate. Photo / Marty Melville
Gisborne: Kerry Hudson receives NZOM for services to land management https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/03/gisborne-kerry-hudson-receives-nzom-for-services-to-land-management/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/03/gisborne-kerry-hudson-receives-nzom-for-services-to-land-management/ Wynsley WrigleyLand conservator Kerry Hudson has been named a Member of the NZ Order of Merit. Sun, 02 Jun 2024 23:58:06 +0000 Gisborne District Council soil conservation team leader Kerry Hudson has been awarded a NZOM in the King's Birthday Honours list. He is pictured after being awarded the outstanding contribution award at the NZ Association of Resource Management conference last year.
New Auckland University survey asks parents of donor-conceived children: have you told them? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/new-survey-asks-parents-of-donor-conceived-children-have-you-told-them/BQH5AMZ7KVGWDMLKCP7BVUGQ3I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/new-survey-asks-parents-of-donor-conceived-children-have-you-told-them/BQH5AMZ7KVGWDMLKCP7BVUGQ3I/ Jamie MortonFor parents of donor-conceived children, it’s the trickiest question: when to tell them? Sun, 02 Jun 2024 23:29:24 +0000 Donor-conceived children have a legal right to receive identifying information about their donor when they turn 18. Photo / 123rf
